definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]

sentences.english: But it isn't hard to foresee how visionary circadian-clock therapies might work.
sentences.chinese: 但是不難預見想象的生物鐘治療法會怎樣起作用。

sentences.english: It is not just women who are hearing the tick-tock either.
sentences.chinese: 當然，聽到生物鐘的滴答聲的不光僅是女性。

sentences.english: In fact, mutant mice that have no circadian clocks tend to be chunky.
sentences.chinese: 比如無生物鐘的變種小鼠身形就趨於矮胖。

sentences.english: The biological clock itself is believed to be a cluster of nerve cells called the suprachiasmatic nucleus.
sentences.chinese: 生物鐘被認爲是叫做視交叉上核的神經細胞的聚集。

sentences.english: Men have a biological clock too.
Becomes pregnant the date should also arrange in the human body "the biological clock" high-tide period.
sentences.chinese: 受孕日期還應安排在人體“生物鐘”的高潮期。

sentences.english: Can your biorhythms actually make or break your career?
sentences.chinese: 你的生物鐘真的能幫助你的工作或者拖後腿嗎？

sentences.english: Hormones are synchronized with the wake-sleep cycle.
sentences.chinese: 人的荷爾蒙會和生物鐘的循環同步。

definition: to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2
